questions.question_text:
You need to execute a script on a remote instance through Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Resource Manager.
Which option can you use? (Choose the best answer.)

discussion.content:
D, is correct.
With Resource Manager, you can use Terraform's remote exec functionality to execute scripts or commands on a remote computer. You can also use this technique for other provisioners that require access to the remote resource.

choices.C: Download the script to a local desktop and execute the script.
choices.A: Use /bin/sh with the full path to the location of the script to execute the script.

questions.question_text:
You are a consumer of Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) Streaming service.
Which API should you use to read and process the stream? (Choose the best answer.)

discussion.content:
Here is the explanation, why it's B.
https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/api/#/en/streaming/20180418/Message/GetMessages

B, is correct.
Build consumers to read and process messages from a stream using the GetMessages API

questions.question_text: Which Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) load balancer shape is used by default in OCI Container Engine for Kubernetes? (Choose the best answer.)

choices.C: There is no default. The shape has to be specified.

discussion.content:
D, is correct.
The shape of an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure load balancer specifies its maximum total bandwidth (that is, ingress plus egress). 
By default, load balancers are created with a shape of 100Mbps. 
Other shapes are available, including 400Mbps and 8000Mbps.

choices.C: Service choreography relies on a central coordinator.
choices.E: Decision logic in service choreography is distributed.
choices.B: Services involved in choreography communicate through messages/messaging systems.
choices.D: Service choreography should not use events for communication.
choices.A: Service choreographer is responsible for invoking other services.

comments.content: this is an Oracle Exam - not Microsoft...
Didn't find much OCI documentation around this.. Many blogs and other sources also point to B&E as answer.
This is an architectural prototype not from microsoft, oracle or others. Coreography and orchestration could be use when you create microservice apps (or distributed systems/apps).

discussion.content: Based on the stackoverflow description https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4127241/orchestration-vs-choreography I would also vote on B,E using events is not mentioned, messaging is mentioned and decentralization is also mentioned. Events is a different layer I think.

B, E
Service Choreography

Service choreography is a global description of the participating services, which is defined by exchange of messages, rules of interaction and agreements between two or more endpoints. Choreography employs a decentralized approach for service composition. the decision logic is distributed, with no centralized point.





Choreography, in contrast, does not rely on a central coordinator. and all participants in the choreography need to be aware of the business process, operations to execute, messages to exchange, and the timing of message exchanges.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true for service choreography? (Choose two.)
Which testing approaches is a must for achieving high velocity of deployments and releases of cloud-native applications? (Choose the best answer.)

comments.content: Agree looks more like C than A
